name: Appam with Stew
description: Soft hoppers made from fermented rice batter, served with vegetable or chicken stew.
instructions: Soak rice and grind with coconut. Add yeast and sugar, ferment overnight. Cook in appachatti. Serve hot with stew.

name: Puttu and Kadala Curry
description: Steamed rice flour with coconut layers, paired with black chickpea curry.
instructions: Steam rice flour with coconut in a puttu maker. Cook chickpeas with onion and spices for kadala curry. Serve together.

name: Idiyappam
description: String hoppers made from rice flour, usually served with curry or coconut milk.
instructions: Mix rice flour with hot water to form dough. Press through idiyappam maker, steam until cooked. Serve with stew or curry.

name: Kerala Fish Curry
description: Spicy fish curry cooked with coconut and tamarind.
instructions: Fry spices in coconut oil, add tamarind and water. Add fish pieces and simmer until cooked.

name: Chicken Roast
description: Kerala-style spicy chicken roast with coconut oil and curry leaves.
instructions: Marinate chicken in spices, shallow fry in coconut oil, add onions and curry leaves, roast until dry.

name: Beef Ularthiyathu
description: Dry-fried beef with coconut slices, spices, and curry leaves.
instructions: Cook beef with spices. Stir fry with coconut slices and curry leaves until dark and dry.

name: Vegetable Thoran
description: Dry stir-fried vegetables with grated coconut.
instructions: Fry mustard, chili, add vegetables and grated coconut. Stir fry until cooked but not mushy.

name: Avial
description: Mixed vegetables cooked with coconut and yogurt, seasoned with curry leaves.
instructions: Cook vegetables with little water. Add ground coconut and yogurt mix, season with curry leaves.

name: Sambar
description: Traditional South Indian lentil and vegetable curry with tamarind.
instructions: Cook dal, add tamarind, sambar powder, and vegetables. Boil until flavors blend.

name: Banana Chips
description: Crispy fried raw banana slices, a classic Kerala snack.
instructions: Peel bananas, slice thin, fry in coconut oil, sprinkle salt, and store airtight.

name: Unniyappam
description: Sweet rice flour fritters made with banana and jaggery.
instructions: Mix rice flour, mashed banana, and jaggery syrup. Fry spoonfuls in oil until golden.

name: Parippu Vada
description: Crispy lentil fritters made with spiced chana dal.
instructions: Soak chana dal, grind coarsely, mix with spices and onion. Shape into patties and deep fry.
